intro: Bromus quitensis, commonly known as the Andean brome, is a perennial grass native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. It typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant has slender,丛生 (clump-forming) growth habit with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are often clustered in dense, cylindrical arrangements. Bromus quitensis plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
